trustfund:
TF038932-MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA,
            JORDAN:PREPARATION OF PSRL II AND ALGERIA,TF026828-PHRD-JORDAN: SECOND PUBLIC
            SECTOR REFORM LOAN

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Public Sector Reform Loan
            Project will contribute to the Government's growth
            promoting fiscal program, while external resources will
            reinforce the country's foreign reserve position, and
            underpin nominal exchange rate stability. Disbursements will
            be on the basis of satisfactory progress in the public
            sector management program, measured by actions improving the
            Government's institutional capacity, and incentives to
            deliver quality public services, as well as on the continued
            sound overall macroeconomic management. While the project
            will contribute in maintaining a stronger financial position
            to face economic, and political shocks, the continuing
            uncertainty in the Middle East could risk implementation of
            programs as described above. However, Jordan's past
            record demonstrates its strong, and sound economic, and
            political performance which far outweighs those risks.
            Moreover, the inherent long-term and comprehensive nature of
            public sector reforms, entails a slow implementation, whose
            fragmentation may jeopardize its coherency. Nonetheless, the
            appointment of an inter-ministerial steering committee, and
            the continued dialogue with the Bank, as well as other
            external partners, suggests the latter risk is manageable.
